metadata.title: CVE-2024-35815 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved: fs/aio:Check IOCB_AIO_RW before the struct aio_kiocb conversion The firstkiocb_set_cancel_fn() argument may point at a struct kiocb that is notembedded inside struct aio_kiocb. With the current code, depending on thecompiler, the req->ki_ctx read happens either before the IOCB_AIO_RW testor after that test. Move the req->ki_ctx read such that it is guaranteedthat the IOCB_AIO_RW test happens first.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-35815` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
linux-image-extra-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
linux-image-hmac-4.4.0-1001-fips - 4.4.0-1001.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: linux-fips package in fips/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '4.4.0-1001.1').
